question: What Windows app in Windows 10 combines many utilities into a unified tool?
What CPU feature enables the microprocessor to support running multiple operation systems at the same time?

Silas has and AMD-based motherboard with two sticks of DDR3 RAM installed in two of the three RAM slots for a total of 8 GB of system memory. When he runs CPU-Z to test the system, he notices that the software claims he's running single-channel memory. What could be the problem? (Select the best answer)
options: His motherboard only supports dual-channel memory.
His motherboard only supports dual-channel memory with DDR2 RAM, not DDR3.
He needs to install a third RAM stick to enable dual-channel memory.
He needs to move one of the installed sticks to a different slot to activate dual-Channel memory.
correct: He needs to move one of the installed sticks to a different slot to activate dual-Channel memory.

question: Which of the following most accurately describes the relationship between BIOS and hardware?
options: All hardware that attaches to the motherboard via ribbon cables needs BIOS.
All hardware built into the motherboard needs BIOS.

question: Solon has avery buffy computer that keeps locking up at odd moments and rebooting spontaneously. He suspects the motherboard. How should he test it?
options: Check settings and verify good components.
Verify good components and document all testing.
Replace the motherboard first to see if the problems disappear.
Check settings, verify good components, replace components and document all testing.
correct: Check settings, verify good components, replace components and document all testing.

question: A PC's power supply provides DC power in what standard configuration?
options: Two primary voltage rails, 12 volts and 5 volts, and an auxiliary 3.3 volt connector.
Three primary voltage rails, one each for 12 volt, 5 volt, and 3.3 volt connectors.
One primary DC voltage rail for 12 volt, 5 volt and 3.3 volt connectors.
One voltage rail with a 12 volt connector for the motherboard, a second voltage rail with a 12 volt connector for the CPU, and a third voltage rail for the 5 volt and 3.3 volt connectors.
correct: Three primary voltage rails, one each for 12 volt, 5 volt, and 3.3 volt connectors.

question: Which SATA version offers the least overhead (and thus best performance)?
Which of the following correctly identifies the four possible entries in a file allocation table?
options: Number of the starting cluster number of the ending cluster, number of used clusters, number of available clusters.
An end-of-file marker, a bad-block marker, code indicating the cluster is available, the number of the cluster where the next part of the file is stored.
File name, folder location, starting cluster number, ending cluster number.
correct: An end-of-file marker, a bad-block marker, code indicating the cluster is available, the number of the cluster where the next part of the file is stored.

question: You've just replaced Jane's Windows 7 PC with a new Windows 10 machine. What post-installation tool should you run to make the transition as painless as possible for her?
Which of the following root keys contains the data for a system's non-user-specific configurations?

You copy a file from a folder on a hard drive formatted as NTFS, with permissions set to Read for everyone, to a USB thumb drive formatted as FAT32. What effective permissions does the copy of the file have?
options: You can't copy a file from an NTFS drive to a FAT32 drive.

question: What tool enable you to modify which programs start when Windows 10 starts?
Which of the following commands will delete all the files in a directory in Linux?
What can device drivers and failing hardware in macOS and LInux cause?
Which of the following is an example of a hybrid topology?
Which of the following is the correct net syntax for discovering which network shares on a particular server are mapped on your computer?
What technology enables 802.11n networks to make multiple simultaneous connections and thus improve speed over previous Wi-Fi standards?
What option often enables you to diagnose TCP/IP errors such as connection problems?
What is the difference between a virtual machine (VM) and an emulator?
options: A VM converts commands to and from a host machine to and entirely different platform, whereas an emulator creates an environment based on the host machine and does no converting.
An emulator converts commands to and from a host machine to and entirely different platform, whereas a VM creates an environment based on the host machine and does no converting.
An emulator requires a host OS, whereas a VM runs on bare-metal servers without and OS.
A VM requires a host OS, whereas an emulator runs on bare-metal servers without an OS.
correct: An emulator converts commands to and from a host machine to and entirely different platform, whereas a VM creates an environment based on the host machine and does no converting.

question: Which of the following display types will you commonly find on a portable PC today?
What information do you need to connect an Android-based tablet to an IMAP account?
options: Username, password, sending and receiving server addresses.
Exchange server name, username and password.
correct: Username, password, sending and receiving server addresses.

question: Which mobile operating system requires a third-party software firewall?
Which tool would help you determine why a print job didn't print?
Which hardware firewall feature enables incoming traffic on a specific port to reach an IP address on the LAN?
What broad term describes the process of creating a roadmap for current and future techs to make changes or repairs over time for an organization?
